project.name: Portfolio Website — Three.js + GSAP
project.description: An immersive scroll-driven portfolio website built in three phases: (1) GSAP scroll animations, (2) Three.js 3D model integration, (3) SVG animations and polish. Deployed to GitHub Pages.

developer_intent.primary_goal: Build a professional portfolio website with scroll-driven animations and 3D elements while learning through collaboration with GitHub Copilot.
learning_focus: GSAP ScrollTrigger for advanced scroll animations
Three.js scene setup with scroll-driven camera
copilot_rules: Prefer vanilla JavaScript — do not suggest React or frameworks unless explicitly requested.
Write modular and readable code using ES module imports/exports.
Include concise inline comments explaining structure and reasoning.
Do not generate complete files or long boilerplate unless explicitly asked.
Focus on educational, production-ready code over placeholder content.

phase_1.name: Core Layout & Scroll Animation
phase_1.description: Build foundational four-section scroll layout with GSAP ScrollTrigger
features: Section 1: Hero with text left, image/placeholder right (image moves horizontally on scroll)
Section 2: New text left, image continues moving right
Section 3: Image scales down, centers, then scrolls out; text animates in (triggered, not scrolled)
Section 4: Two columns animate in from sides, footer animates in last
deliverables: Responsive HTML structure with four sections
GSAP ScrollTrigger animations for image movement and scaling
Column and footer animations for Section 4

phase_2.name: Three.js 3D Model Integration
phase_2.description: Replace placeholder image with Three.js canvas rendering an animated 3D model
features: Sync 3D canvas with scroll animations from Phase 1
deliverables: Three.js scene with lighting and camera setup
Camera animation timeline synced to scroll

phase_3.name: SVG Animations & Visual Polish
phase_3.description: Enhance site with decorative SVG animations and micro-interactions

html_css.style_guide: minimalistic and clean; use CSS for layout, GSAP for motion

collaboration_guidelines.copilot_role: Assist with setup, propose modular patterns, explain unfamiliar code.
collaboration_guidelines.developer_role: Write core logic, refine design, understand every implementation.
collaboration_guidelines.communication_style: Concise and educational — prefer short suggestions over long outputs.
